required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of School Teachers in Care Navigation and Signposting Dental Caries in Primary School Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of School Teachers in Care Navigation and Signposting Dental Caries

lead_sponsor.agency: Khartoum Centre for Research and Medical Training

clinical_study.source: Khartoum Centre for Research and Medical Training

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to investigate the role of school teachers in care navigation and signposting dental caries in primary school children.

detailed_description.textblock: Dental caries is a multifactorial disease with high prevalence in children. Dental caries is a global public health problem with detrimental impact in developing countries. Despite advances in caries management and detection poorer countries continue to suffer a high burden of disease. Advances in care navigation and sign-posting concepts are increasingly being utilized in general health care to aid early diagnosis and ease the burden of disease in poorer communities. This study aims to investigate the role of primary school teachers as care navigators with regard to dental caries in children.

primary_outcome.description: decay component of the Index of decayed, extracted and filled teeth for the groups (deft)

secondary_outcome.measure: caries experience for the most affected one third (SIC index)
secondary_outcome.description: SIC index (deft of the most affected one third of each group)
proportion of filled and extracted teeth (df/deft)

arm_group.description: The teachers will signpost dental caries based on ICCMS visual criteria and refer to the nearest service. Annual monitoring of caries

intervention.description: Identify carious lesion according to ICCMS visual criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Healthy school children between the ages of 5-8 years Regular school attender Lives in the local village Co-operative
Exclusion Criteria:
- known medical history or disability
- irregular school attenders

facility.name: Khartoum Centre for Research and Medical Training

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Khartoum Centre for Research and Medical Training
